bibl.title: Letter from Judah Kyriakos, bishop of Jerusalem, to Papa bar Aggai

div.p: This text is a born-digital edition of the Letter from Judah Kyriakos, bishop of Jerusalem, to Papa bar Aggai. The letter is part of a corpus of eight letters representing the correspondence of Papa bar Aggai, early 4th-century bishop of Seleucia, with some exponents of the western political and religious power. Beside the Letter from Judah Kyriakos bishop of Jerusalem to Papa, the corpus includes: a letter from Eusebius of Rome to Papa, a letter from the Empress Helena to Papa, a letter from Papa to the Empress Helena, a letter from Jacob bishop of Nisibis to Papa, a letter from Ephrem to Papa, a letter from Papa to the citizens of Nisibis, the letter sent by the Western Fathers on the illegal removal of Papa.
This edition is based on the following manuscript witnesses:

div.l: Rome, Vatican Library, Borg. Sir. 82, f. 114v-115r (B);
Trichur, Chaldean Syrian Church, APSTCH THRI 65, f. 48r/v (A) (the manuscript has been digitized, and it can be viewed here);
Baghdad, Chaldean Catholic Church. Patriarchate of Baghdad 377, f. 12r/v (C) (the manuscript has been digitized, and it can be viewed here).

div.p: This text has never been published in any prior edition.
This edition should not be considered as definitive but as a still in-progress material.

There is an old German translation of the entire corpus (based on the Syriac text preserved in ms Borg. Sir. 82) in O. Braun, "Der Briefwechsel des Katholikos Papa von Seleucia. Ein Beitrag zur Geschichte der ostsyrischen Kirche im vierten Jahrhundert", Zeitschrift für katholische Theologie 18 (1894), pp. 163-182, 546-565.
An English translation is provided along with the Syriac text.
This edition is an outcome of the Marie Skłodowska-Curie Global Fellowship 2022 – Project "ForM - FORGED MEMORIES: the Church of Late Antique Iran and the West", funded by the European Commission.

M1 C ܘܥܲܕܪܘ ܠܲܡܕܝܼܢ̄ܬܢ ܩܲܕܿܝܫܼܬܐ ܇ ܚܲܫܹ̈ܐ ܣܒܼܝܼ̈ܣܹܐ ܘܐܘܼܠܨ̈ܢܹܐ ܥܲܡܘܼ̈ܛܹܐ ܕܲܒܼܗܘܿܢ ܐܸܬܼܢܲܨܲܚܼܬܿ܆ ܒܲܡܣܲܝܒܿܪܢܘܼܬܼܵܟ ܕܲܒܼܟܼܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܵܓܘܿܢܝ̈ܟ ܘܢܸܣܝܘܿܢܝ̈ܟ ܕܡܼܢ ܚܲܢ̈ܦܸܐ. ܘܥܵܩܬܵܐ ܘܚܲܕܘܼܬܼܐ ܬܲܪ̈ܬܲܝܗܹܝܢ ܐܸܫܬܲܠܛ ܒܲܢ܆ ܥܵܩܬܼܐ̣ ܡܸܛܠ ܟܲܪܝܘܼܬܲܢ ܥܲܠ
ܪܲܒܿܘܼܬܼ ܟܲܗܢܘܼܬܼܵܟ. ܘܚܲܕܘܬܼܵܐܼ ܕܢܨܚܼܬܿ ܘܲܫܩܲܠܬܿ ܟܠܝܼܠܵܐ ܕܙܵܟܼܘܼܬܼܵܐ. ܘܪܲܡܪܸܡܼܬܿ ܠܥܹܕܬܵܐ ܒܡܘܼܟܵܟܼܵܟ ܕܥܲܠ ܐܲܦܹܝ̈ܗܿ. ܘܗܸܢܹܝ̈ܢ ܗܵܠܹܝܢ ܡܼܢ ܣܲܓܝܼ̈ܐܐ ܐܸܬܿܛܒܒܿ ܒܡܲܫܡܲܥܬܼܵܐ ܕܗܹܠܹܢܹܐ
ܡܲܠܟܿܬܼܵܐ. ܘܐܝܟ ܕܨܵܒܲܝܵܐ ܕܲܒܼܟܼܠܗܘܿܢ ܐܬܪ̈ܘܬܼܵܐ ܕܬܹܒܼܢܹܐ ܘܲܬܼܪܡܪܸܡ ܥܹܕܿܬܹܗ ܕܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ ܒܟܼܠ ܨܹܒܼܬ̈ܝܼܢ ܆
ܝܲܬܿܝܼܪܐܝܼܬܼ ܆ ܒܲܡܕܝܼ̈ܢܵܬܼܐ ܪܵܘܪ̈ܒܼܵܬܼܐ ܆ ܨܵܒܲܝܵܐ ܕܒܲܡܕܝܼܢ̄ܬܵܐ ܕܝܼܠܟܼܘܿܢ ܣܵܠܸܝܼܩ ܬܹܒܼܢܹܐ ܥܸܕܿܬܵܐ ܠܡܵܪܝܵܐ ܡܫܝܼܚܵܐ. ܘܒܼܵܥܝܵܐ ܡܲܦܣܵܢܘܼܬܼܵܐ ܡܼܢ ܐܲܒܼܵܗܘܼܬܼܟܼܘܿܢ. ܘܥܲܡ ܡܲܦܣܵܢܘܼܬܼܐ ܡܸܠܟܵܐ. ܘܐܲܝܟ ܕܡܸܢܵܗܿ ܐܬܼܦܩܿܕܬܼ ܠܪܒܿܘܼܬܼ ܟܵܗܢܘܼܬܼܟܼܘܿܢ ܟܹܬܼܒܹܿܬܼ. ܐܲܢ̄ܬܿ ܕܹܝܢ ܡܵܪܝ. ܐܲܝܟ ܪܚܡܲܬܸ ܐܲܠܵܗܵܐ ܕܒܼܵܟ܆ ܣܥܼܘܿܪ. ܘܐܵܘܕܲܥܹܝܗܿ ܐܲܝܕܵܐ ܕܥܵܕܪܐ ܠܗܿ. ܟܲܕ ܡܸܬܼܚܲܪܪܐ ܡܼܢ ܟܸܫܠܵܐ. ܨܲܠܵܐ ܥܠܲܝܢ܆ ܘܥܲܠ ܡܲܠܟܵܐ ܙܲܟܵܝܐ ܒܪܵܗܿ ܩܘܼܣܛܲܢܛܝܼܢܘܿܣ: ܘܥܲܠ ܟܠܗܘܿܢ ܦܵܠܚܹ̈ܐ ܕܡܲܠܟܿܘܼܬܹܗ.
Another [letter] from Judah Kyriakos, bishop of Jerusalem, to Papa.

To Father Papa, high priest and first of the evangelists (sic) , Judah Kyriakos pays respect to your high priesthood in our Lord. The prophet Isaiah has predicted about you and about the saints like you: The glory of the Lord is proclaimed through them from the ends of the world, and by the sailors (lit. those who go down to the sea) and the ones who inhabit the islands and those who live in the desert; and from the top of the mountains may they cry out from their caverns, and may those who sit on steep rocks glorify in the voice of their holiness (cf. Isaiah 42, 10-11). Rejoice, my lord. You helped our holy city. [There was] frequent suffering and dark oppression in which you triumphed by your endurance in all your struggles and trials from the pagans. Both distress and joy occupied us: the distress caused by our sadness on your high priesthood’s behalf, and joy, since you triumphed and received the crown of victory, and you exalted your church through your lowliness on its behalf. And these are those things among many that were reported in Empress Helen’s hearing. Accordingly, she desires to build up in all places and exalt the church of Christ with every adornment, especially in the great cities. She desires that in your city of Seleucia, a church be built to the Lord Christ. And she seeks permission from your Fatherhood, and with the permission, counsel. And since I was commanded by her, I wrote to your high priesthood. You, then, my lord, as a friend of the God who [is] with you, provide and show her [your] helpful hand, while not taking offense. Pray for us and for the victorious emperor, her son Constantine, and for all the servants of his kingdom.
